comment: Top end to lockdown whisky tasting #2. Really nice after taste

Love at first sip. Although I knew it was discontinued, I opened one of my two bottles for my best friend's wedding. Totally worth it! Slightly oaky and orange hints. It's young age wasn't present through bites of alcohol but sort of springy notes and burst o flavour. Much, much better than the 12y.o
An old over wintered bouteille still going strong. Spicy warm
Simple and straightforward, it's got its own taste
b.1989 -light creamy fresh lemon grass, honey, oats, easy dram. mellow through out not long lasting or complex but consitent on the finish. Kept in decanter

A really mild aroma on the nose, maybe a little weak. Immediate notes of honey, strong floral notes, and a lot of apply juice in the finish. Not a ton of peat, less when it’s cold. Overall this is really enjoyable.
w/ charlie renee in PVD @ east end. mesquite. pine. toasted.
Glenkinchie 10, Lowland (Classic) 94 pts.  Fruity and somewhat floral, it’s very approachable and easy-drinking. Lighter body with a very drying finish.
